result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leonard John Lentz

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leonard John Lentz in court.  Attorney Nicole A. Muller in court for Leonard John Lentz.  Attorney Olivia Simmons in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Pretrial/Status/Scheduling conference held.  Atty. Muller requests a final pretrial and trial date.  Court orders any pretrial documents be filed no later than 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Leonard John Lentz appeared by video.  Attorney Nicole A. Muller appeared by video for Leonard John Lentz.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
OFF THE RECORD.  Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Muller informed the state they are missing some discovery.  State has offered a DPA to the defendant and a TAD evaluation needs to be scheduled. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RM, TM. 
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Leonardo John Lentz in court.  Attorney Nicole A. Muller in court for Leonardo John Lentz. Student Intern Abigail Doweiko in court under the supervision of Prosecuting attorney Thomas L. Potter by telephone for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 1.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
